title: Man goes on breastfeeding rant that mums shouldn’t take kids to the pub
text:
Dozens of mums have hit back after man went on a ‘ridiculous’ rant about someone breastfeeding in the pub. 
Sheldon Sparks left a rambling post on a Facebook group for people in Bristol, saying that it wasn’t appropriate for a mother to have two glasses of wine ‘then flop a breast out’.
Internet bride has murder inquiry overturned after being linked to death of husband He said her baby would get ‘more like 14% Pinot Grigio’ and she should breastfeed in a local park instead.
His comments went viral with people saying they were offensive and women had the right to feed their babies where they wanted.
But Mr Sparks refused to apologise, defending his comments today as ‘blown out of proportion’.
Speaking this morning from his house in Bedminster, Bristol, he said: ‘I just don’t think it should be seen in the pub.
‘If you went to pubs or restaurants years ago people used to cover themselves up with a blanket.’
(Picture: SWNS) He added that he’s been told not to say anything by his employer.
Marine who shot Taliban fighter could walk from jail within weeks Mr Sparks’ posted his message on local Facebook page BS3 Connect but was forced to delete it on Sunday night after receiving more than 300 responses.
‘It’s such a shame that parents nowadays think it’s acceptable to take Babies and children to pubs… maybe they are unaware of local green spaces,’ he said.
It followed a visit to an unknown pub in the city centre’s North Street, to complain about a mother who had been breastfeeding her young baby.
The rant in full When is it acceptable to take a 5 week old baby to one of the busiest pubs in North Street…. then have 2 large glasses of wine… and then think it is appropriate to flop a breast out in the middle of a very busy pub and so say feed it… (unfortunately I really don’t think there would be much milk it would be receiving… more like 14% Pinot Grigio).
I may be old fashioned… but do new born babies really need to be introduced to pubs at such an early age… It’s such a shame that parents nowadays think it’s acceptable to take Babies and children to pubs… maybe they are unaware of local green spaces… like South Street Playing Fields or Grevill Smyth Park even exist…
You never know if they ventured to one of those places they may at least be able to interact with other children, and parents with other children of a similar age… and maybe get a bit of fresh air, and actually (god forbid) interact with their own child, that they have bought into this world… instead of chucking it a pram and parading around the local pubs and cafes within the area.

His post was followed by dozens of responses by people saying breastfeeding should not be seen as something shameful that should be covered up.
‘I feed my daughter wherever I am whenever she needs it and have never had any negative feedback,’ Lorna Cahill said.
‘Here I am “flopping a breast out” at the busy South mims service station.’
